content:
I never know how to use the E-{easy,medium,hard} labels.
Often I find myself wanting to tag something as E-easy, but it may not be quite so straightforward, especially if you've never done anything in the compiler before. Or there might be some unknowns (e.g. how to present a particular diagnostic).
so I worry about "overpromising" that something is easy when it could still be a bit of a stretch for a new contributor
I'd at least like to advertise that it could be a stretch
maybe I can do that by tagging E-easy and saying so in a comment, actually
but overall I end up feeling like there should be something between E-easy and E-medium (or maybe an E-very-easy? =)
yeah I'm not sure labels are the best place to convey shades of grey

tmandry said:

but overall I end up feeling like there should be something between E-easy and E-medium (or maybe an E-very-easy? =)

I think I would count easy + mentor as very easy
that says 'it will be easy to do and here is how to do it'
E-easy just means 'it will be easy to do, but you may have to figure it out yourself'
eh, I often tag E-mentor for things where I give a rough approach to how I'd do it, but there are still steps they'll have to fill in themselves
(I'm also committing to help them if they get stuck, mind you)
the prototypical example for me is like "go search for where this diagnostic is and add a new case, here's an idea for what I think it should say"
that seems e-mentor e-medium to me
'here's how to do it, but you have to figure out how diagnostics work'
yeah that may be more E-medium
I guess that's part of what I'm trying to figure out here
but as long as I'm consistent within a given area / working group, that should be good enough
I generally see E-Easy as "we have to do this thing 12 times and we've already done 2, but we need help to do the last 10" so that people can mostly just copy stuff that's done elsewhere.
nb: It feels discouraging to try an easy issue and get walled by running into a problem and not being able to articulate properly what help you need because you are that confused.
I feel like E-easy ought to have no unknowns
no known unknowns :wink:
It should be known that there are no known unknowns
